dc:title: On Pilgrimage - April 1949
dc:author: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Upset over the labor conflict between the Archdiocese of New York with its striking cemetery workers, she insists on only non-violent techniques and calls for love to overcome bitterness and resentment. Says Peter Maurin wanted to overcome divisions between clergy and laity. Notes her new book On Pilgrimage "is selling slowly and steadily."
